cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Prof. Oak's Research
text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
text: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: VS Seeker
text: Search your discard pile for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Potion
text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

cards.name: Switch
text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Multi Energy
text: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) Multi Energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it."

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Link Needle
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage for each Beedrill (excluding this one) you have in play.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. After doing damage, flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Mt. Moon
text: Any Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) with maximum HP less than 70 can't use any Poké-Powers.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

cards.name: PokéDex (HANDY909)
text: Shuffle your deck. Look at 6 cards from the top of your deck, then put them back on top of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Poliwhirl.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Data Retrieval
attacks.text: If you have less than 4 cards in your hand, draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Gouge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Pokémon Reversal
text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Run Around
attacks.text: Switch Doduo with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Slow Trip Gas
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Slowpoke and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Bill's Maintenance
text: If you have any cards in your hand, shuffle 1 of them into your deck, then draw 3 cards.
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

cards.name: Energy Removal 2
text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

cards.name: Energy Switch
text: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Great Ball
text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Life Herb
text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), and remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 6).

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

ability.name: Power Gene
ability.text: As long as Nidoking is in play, your attacks by Nidoran ♀, Nidorina, Nidoqueen, Nidoran ♂, and Nidorino do 10 more damage to the Defending Pokemon.

attacks.name: Earth Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bound Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Nidoking can't use Bound Crush during your next turn.

ability.name: Spiral
ability.text: As long as Poliwrath is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Confused Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Retreat Aid
ability.text: As long as Dodrio is on your Bench, you pay Colorless Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Baby Pokémon)."

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hoard
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that already have a Pokémon Tool attached to them). Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Toss
attacks.text: You may discard from your hand as many Technical Machine and Pokémon Tool cards as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Poison Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Thick Skin
ability.text: Raticate can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon (or Evolution card), a Trainer card, and an Energy card. Show them to your opponent and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Trainer card in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage.

ability.name: Safeguard
ability.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dewgong by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Basic Pokémon and each Evolution card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Psychic Exchange
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Draw up to 8 cards.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads

ability.name: Quick Search
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose any 1 card from your deck and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Quick Search Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Pidgeot is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Salt Water
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards and attach them to Kingler. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyper Pump
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy attached to Kingler but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

ability.name: Family Bonds
ability.text: As long as Nidoqueen is in play, the Retreat Cost for Nidoran ♀, Nidorina, Nidoran ♂, Nidorino and Nidoking is 0.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Power Lariat
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Evolved Pokémon you have in play.

ability.name: Exoskeleton
ability.text: Any damage done to Cloyster by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Bubble
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Head Trip
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Haunter is on your Bench, you may use this power. One of your Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Energy Powder
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Toxic Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to Raichu. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Reflection
attacks.text: You may move any number of Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Magikarp and put it on Magikarp. (This counts as evolving Magikarp.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Shellder by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Strange Behavior
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Rest Up
ability.text: If Snorlax remains Asleep between turns, remove 2 damage counters from Snorlax (remove 1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Snorlax is now asleep.

attacks.name: Toss and Turn
attacks.text: If Snorlax is Asleep, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. (This attack can be used even if Snorlax is Asleep.)

ability.name: Acid Sampler
ability.text: As long as Victreebel is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Defending Pokémon between turns. Acid Sampler stops working if your other Active Pokémon is not a Victreebel.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Free Flight
ability.text: If Fearow has no Energy attached to it, Fearow's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Shot Air
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Eerie Aura
ability.text: As long as Hypno is your Active Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on each Pokémon that remains Asleep between turns.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

ability.name: Leaf Ride
ability.text: If Scyther has any Energy attached to it, Scyther's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Vine Tease
attacks.text: Look at your Prize cards without showing your opponent. Choose 1 of the Prize cards and switch it with the top card of your deck without looking at the top card of your deck. If you have no cards in your deck, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Wiggle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has already any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Poison Payback
ability.text: If Kakuna is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Kakuna is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Onix can't attack during your next turn.

ability.name: Thick Skin
ability.text: Persian can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Shining Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wartortle but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Wartortle with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Assistance
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Wigglytuff is on your Bench, you may choose 1 of your Active Pokémon and remove 1 Special Condition from it.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wigglytuff by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metapod and a Butterfree card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gesture
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Look for Friends
attacks.text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Basic Pokémon. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Basic Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Nidoran ♀ or a Nidoran ♂ card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Pikachu.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Psycho Waves
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Venonat. The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Spurt
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy card attached to Weedle. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: EXP. ALL
text: During your opponent's turn, if 1 of your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by your opponent's attack, you may take 1 basic Energy card attached to that Knocked Out Pokémon and attach it to the Pokémon with EXP.ALL attached to it. If you do, discard EXP.ALL.

Attach EXP. ALL to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

ability.name: Energy Rain
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blastoise ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, your opponent discards an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Energy Flame
ability.text: All Energy attached to Charizard ex are Fire Energy instead of its usual type.

attacks.name: Burn Down
attacks.text: Discard 5 Fire Energy attached to Charizard ex. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, and any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Clefable ex's type is still Colorless.) Clefable ex performs that attack. "

ability.name: Extra Energy Bomb
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard Electrode ex and all the cards attached to it (this counts as Knocking Out Electrode ex). If you do, search your discard pile for 5 Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) in any way you like. This power can't be used if Electrode ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Crash and Burn
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy you discarded.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and discard it. If both are tails, this attack does nothing.

ability.name: Magic Odds
ability.text: If Mr. Mime ex would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Mr. Mime ex if that damage is 10, 30, 50, 70, 90, 110, 130, 150, or 170.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Energy Trans
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Venusaur ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned, Burned, and Confused.

cards.name: Celio's Network
text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Sooth Dust
ability.text: As long as Butterfree is your Active Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Form Variation
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Ditto) and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Place Ditto in the discard pile.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Ditto but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more then 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Egg Surprise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Chansey does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, remove 5 damage counters from Chansey. (All if there are less than 5.)

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

ability.name: Fiery Aura
ability.text: As long as Rapidash is your Active Pokémon, put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
